about.title: About
about.description: My name is Roman Pella, I live in Russia and work as a front-end developer. My career has been characterised by continuous professional growth and the successful implementation of a number of projects. Some of my achievements are listed below.
about.subHeader: I am an experienced front-end developer with expertise in modern web technologies. I have a strong understanding of web development principles and best practices, and I strive to create high-quality, user-friendly web applications.

skills.title: Skills
skills.description: I am involved in creating information systems in the field of information security. I have experience developing administrative panels for large products on React, as well as experience leading a development team and mentoring.

resume.title: Resume
resume.description: I am seeking a position as a middle+ or senior front-end developer. I am always open to exploring new opportunities and applying my skills in software development. I am ready to take on complex tasks and contribute to the creation of high-quality products.

sumary.title: Sumary
sumary.subTitle: Roman Pellya
sumary.description: Frontend developer with 2+ years of experience. I specialise in creating responsive and high-performance web applications. I am constantly learning about modern tools and optimising processes.

labels.0: Participated in three large and challenging projects on React.ts
labels.1: Creating and maintaining administrative panels for managing large products.
labels.2: Implementation of complex business logic using React, Redux, and RTK Query.
labels.3: Participation in the full development cycle: from architecture design to testing and deployment.
labels.4: Conducting code reviews and mentoring junior developers.
labels.5: Implementation of best practices (code style, typing, documentation).
labels.6: Development process optimisation: 40% reduction in build time through Webpack and Vite configuration.
labels.7: Achieving 80%+ code coverage for critical modules.
labels.8: Migration to TypeScript, code refactoring, creation of a custom UI library for the project.
labels.9: Setting up unit tests (Jest, React Testing Library) and screenshot testing.
